diagnosis_source: Diagnosis confirmed based on repeated elevated HbA1c measurements, fasting blood glucose levels and clinical history of progressive polyuria and weight change.
primary_symptom_source: Patient reports persistent fatigue over the last six months, interfering with daily activities and worsening in the late afternoon and evenings.
comorbidity_source: Longstanding history of primary hypertension managed in outpatient clinic with stable blood pressure under current medication regimen.
medication_source: First-line oral hypoglycemic agent prescribed according to international diabetes management guidelines for newly diagnosed patients.
dosage_source: Initial low dose regimen chosen to minimize gastrointestinal side effects while maintaining adequate glycemic control targets.
outcome_source: Glycemic markers and blood pressure readings remained stable over three consecutive follow-up visits without acute complications.
risk_score_source: Composite risk score calculated from age, BMI, blood pressure and lipid profile using internal cardiovascular risk model.

diagnosis_source: Confirmed by elevated cardiac troponin levels, characteristic ECG changes and typical chest pain presentation at admission.
primary_symptom_source: Sudden onset retrosternal chest pain radiating to the left arm, persisting longer than thirty minutes and not relieved by rest.
comorbidity_source: Documented elevated LDL cholesterol and triglyceride levels on multiple lab measurements over the past two years.
medication_source: Administered as immediate antiplatelet therapy in accordance with acute coronary syndrome treatment guidelines.
dosage_source: Loading dose given at emergency presentation to achieve rapid platelet inhibition before catheterization.
outcome_source: ST-segment elevation resolved and cardiac biomarkers trended down after successful percutaneous coronary intervention.
risk_score_source: High risk category determined using hospital-specific post-infarction risk stratification calculator combining multiple clinical features.

diagnosis_source: Diagnosis based on fever, productive cough, auscultation findings and chest X-ray demonstrating patchy infiltrates.
primary_symptom_source: Productive cough with yellow sputum lasting for ten days, associated with mild shortness of breath during exertion.
comorbidity_source: No relevant chronic illnesses or prior hospitalizations were reported or documented in the electronic health record.
medication_source: Empiric antibiotic therapy selected according to local resistance patterns for low-risk community-acquired pneumonia.
dosage_source: Standard adult dosage recommended for uncomplicated lower respiratory tract infection over a seven day treatment course.
outcome_source: Symptoms resolved completely and follow-up examination showed clear lung sounds without residual abnormal findings.
risk_score_source: Low clinical risk derived from age, comorbidity profile and absence of hemodynamic instability at presentation.

diagnosis_source: Persistently reduced estimated glomerular filtration rate and structural changes observed on renal ultrasound imaging.
primary_symptom_source: Progressive lower limb swelling reported over several months, worse in the evening and improving partially with rest.
comorbidity_source: Long history of poorly controlled diabetes with prior documentation of microalbuminuria and retinopathy.
medication_source: Renoprotective therapy initiated to reduce intraglomerular pressure and slow the progression of kidney function decline.
dosage_source: Dose titrated from a lower starting dose to achieve target blood pressure without inducing symptomatic hypotension.
outcome_source: Renal function remained within the same chronic disease stage across three follow-up lab assessments.
risk_score_source: Risk score generated by internal model integrating eGFR trends, albuminuria and comorbid cardiovascular conditions.

diagnosis_source: Diagnosis made following structured psychiatric interview and standardized depression rating scale exceeding diagnostic threshold.
primary_symptom_source: Persistent low mood, anhedonia and difficulty concentrating reported nearly every day for more than two months.
comorbidity_source: Chronic excessive worry and physical tension documented in prior mental health visits and questionnaire scores.
medication_source: First-line antidepressant class prescribed according to contemporary practice guidelines for moderate depressive episodes.
dosage_source: Starting dose chosen to minimize side effects with plan to reassess for titration based on clinical response.
outcome_source: Symptom severity scores decreased but did not reach full remission thresholds after eight weeks of treatment.
risk_score_source: Risk score derived from baseline severity, comorbid anxiety and history of prior depressive episodes.
Risk estimate derived from baseline severity, comorbid anxiety and prior depressive episode history combined.

diagnosis_source: Confirmed with spirometry demonstrating irreversible airflow limitation consistent with GOLD criteria for COPD.
primary_symptom_source: Progressive shortness of breath on exertion, limiting walking distance and requiring frequent rest during activities.
comorbidity_source: Long-term daily smoker with over forty pack-years documented in social history and counseling notes.
medication_source: Combination bronchodilator therapy initiated to improve airflow and reduce frequency of exacerbations.
dosage_source: Standard inhaler regimen recommended by manufacturer for maintenance treatment of chronic obstructive symptoms.
outcome_source: Reported exercise tolerance increased and rescue inhaler use decreased according to follow-up clinic documentation.
risk_score_source: Risk score incorporates exacerbation history, spirometry values and smoking exposure to estimate future flare probability.

diagnosis_source: Positive thyroid autoantibodies, ultrasound features and elevated TSH levels consistent with Hashimoto thyroiditis.
primary_symptom_source: Gradual weight gain and cold intolerance reported over several months before endocrine evaluation.
comorbidity_source: No additional chronic illnesses documented and family history is negative for major endocrine disorders.
medication_source: Synthetic thyroid hormone replacement selected to normalize TSH and relieve hypothyroid symptoms.
dosage_source: Weight-based dosing calculated and then slightly adjusted to accommodate patient sensitivity and lab response.
outcome_source: TSH normalized and clinical symptoms largely resolved at twelve week follow-up visit.
risk_score_source: Low risk category assigned due to early diagnosis, good adherence and absence of significant comorbid conditions.

diagnosis_source: Irregularly irregular rhythm on ECG and history of palpitations confirmed paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.
primary_symptom_source: Episodes of rapid, irregular heartbeat lasting several minutes, sometimes associated with mild dizziness.
comorbidity_source: Reduced ejection fraction documented on echocardiography with prior admissions for decompensated heart failure.
medication_source: Direct oral anticoagulant prescribed for stroke prevention according to current atrial fibrillation guidelines.
dosage_source: Dose selected based on renal function and body weight, following manufacturer and guideline recommendations.
outcome_source: No thromboembolic events or major bleeding episodes reported during twelve month follow-up.
risk_score_source: High thromboembolic risk determined by CHA2DS2-VASc score using age, heart failure and comorbidity factors.

diagnosis_source: Recurrent unilateral headache episodes fulfilling International Classification of Headache Disorders criteria.
primary_symptom_source: Throbbing unilateral headaches lasting several hours, aggravated by activity and accompanied by photophobia.
comorbidity_source: No significant medical history or chronic medication use documented in the health record.
medication_source: Acute abortive therapy chosen for moderate to severe migraine attacks unresponsive to simple analgesics.
dosage_source: Taken at onset of headache, with repeat dosing limited according to recommended maximum daily amount.
outcome_source: Attack frequency decreased and responsiveness to early triptan use improved over three month follow-up.
risk_score_source: Low long-term risk since structural brain imaging was normal and there are no additional neurological deficits.

diagnosis_source: Diagnosis supported by positive rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP antibodies and characteristic joint involvement pattern.
primary_symptom_source: Symmetric small joint pain and morning stiffness lasting more than one hour for several months.
comorbidity_source: Mild normocytic anemia documented on multiple complete blood counts during inflammatory flares.
medication_source: Conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug initiated as first-line controller therapy.
dosage_source: Once-weekly oral dosing chosen with concurrent folic acid supplementation to reduce adverse effects.
outcome_source: Joint counts and inflammatory markers improved but residual stiffness persists according to follow-up notes.
risk_score_source: Prognostic score combines seropositivity, baseline erosions and early response to therapy into a single index.
